title: Truth is that a multi-billion dollar company chose MORE MONEY over pleasing customers w/ solo que.
body:
I have never seen a company so greedy in my entire life. They are ONLY thinking about people who play this game with their friends. They are thinking about the prepubescent kids and high school kids who bring a friend or two on board after school, and praying that mommy and daddy will spend their hard earned money to keep young Jimmy happy.

How can you directly slap your consumers right in the face? You lied to us. You took a ranked system, which for the entirety of gaming has been about proving YOUR SOLO SKILL, and completely shat all over it. You should be ashamed of yourselves for being this freaking greedy.

replies.body: Dude you need to go outside or something
wait... so they are making money... by encouraging you to bring in new customers or something?

> [{quoted}](name=CerealBoxOfDoom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E6Zqn6RW,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-06-01T14:42:01.047+0000)
>
> wait... so they are making money... by encouraging you to bring in new customers or something?

Direct statement from Riot: "we want to appeal to people who play together, and the person who plays by himself can go kill himself" they think that friends who play together will try to impress each other by getting more and more skins. They don't care that most people who play ranked are solo players and want to get to certain tier as a goal for themselves. Someone may want to get to Gold, someone might want to get out of Bronze. 

The truth is MOST people dynamic queing are people who have run into each other in games AND HAVE SEEN that the person they added has the potential to carry their lane and/or the game. This puts AT LEAST that many players on your team that you KNOW are good, versus 5 randoms who have a very high chance of being braindead.

"we want to appeal to people who play together, and the person who plays by himself can go kill himself" 
I couldn't find that quote anywhere.

To be fair: Solo queue has never -been- solo queue. It's been solo-or-duo queue. ... So, it has never been about -solo- skill.
It's sad because we can't call them unjust for trying to earn money, rito is a business that is made for it...
Trying to figure out how this is a monetary motivated movement...?
DQ=middle and high school kids who don't know how to manage their money playing with friends=money for rito

funny thing is, outside of ranked, this was already going on to an equal extent... And although solo/duo queue didn't allow 5's, friends still play together... if they cant rank together they play normals together....

so "middle and high school kids who don't know how to manage their money playing with friends" isn't anything that DQ brings to the table that wasn't already there... so again... How is this a monetary motivated movement?

Rito think it is, so they did so.
Trust me Rito is a business, it won't do things that doesn't bring them money.
Your statements hold neither facts or evidence of any kind. Nothing but biased assumptions.
They are a company, what did you expect. And considering they are owned by Tencent now, They arn't going to do anything that will not bring in money.

I have seen many many many more companies that are way more greedy than riot.  So many that I wouldn't even classify riot as greedy, rather a business just making business decisions.

Take a look at the pharmaceutical industry or the oil industry or the beauty products industry.  Way more companies have done way worse things to make money.  Remember that whole thing with valeant jacking up their prices by 5000% on life sustaining mandatory drugs?  Or any other amount of price inflation in the drug industry that is currently taking place.  

On a side note, Ranked has never been purely about solo skill.  It has been said multiple times that this is a team game and they your ability to cooperate and work together with team mates is quintessential to winning games.

Also how did dynamic que make them more money than solo que?  I mean I can understand it because it helps promote the team aspect and playing with friends part of the game, thus making the game last longer and in the long run making more money but you seem to think that they chose it purely due to the money (which I remind you isn't making any quick money but rather it's a long term investment so they have almost no data right now as to whether it was a profitable decision or not).

On the topic of lying to the customer.  I agree with you here, I am not as outraged as you but the way they handled the release of dynamic que and subsequent cancel of solo que could have been handled better and resulted in less outrage.  If they had simply not promised solo que back in the first place then this latest update that it isn't coming back wouldn't have lit a new flame under some peoples butts.

Just my two cents.

That's not a particularly fruitful position to take, and unlikely to be the one chosen by Riot.

The player population is the source of income, and so the more players the more income. Thus it is worthwhile to pursue avenues that increase what might be considered market share of the demographic to which MOBAs appeal.
It's fine. Companies that start to favor more money over pleasing their customers tend to end up with neither money or customers.
